results.title: Concomitant methimazole-induced agranulocytosis and cholestatic jaundice in a young woman.
results.text_hl: As a result, she was initiated on @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Methimazole @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008713 @@@methimazole@@@ for management.

citations.NLM: Alcorn C, Subarajan P, Anderson J. Concomitant methimazole-induced agranulocytosis and cholestatic jaundice in a young woman. BMJ Case Rep. 2022 Aug 25;15(8):. PMID: 36007972
citations.BibTeX: @article{36007972, title={Concomitant methimazole-induced agranulocytosis and cholestatic jaundice in a young woman.}, author={Alcorn C and Subarajan P and Anderson J}, journal={BMJ Case Rep}, volume={15}, number={8}}

results.title: Comparison between moexipril and atenolol in obese postmenopausal women with hypertension.
results.text_hl: Most frequent adverse events under monotherapy (@CHEMICAL_moexipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:C058302 @@@moexipril@@@/@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@) were @DISEASE_Asthenia @DISEASE_MESH:D001247 @@@asthenia@@@ (5.3/13.0%), @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@ (13.2/21.7%), @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ (7.9/6.5%), @<m>DISEASE_Pharyngitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010612 @@@pharyngitis@@@ (21.1/8.7%) and @DISEASE_Peripheral_Nervous_System_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D010523 @@@peripheral oedema@@@ (5.3/13.0%).

citations.NLM: Stimpel M, Koch B, Weber MA. Comparison between moexipril and atenolol in obese postmenopausal women with hypertension. Maturitas. 1998 Sep 20;30(1):69-77. PMID: 9819786
citations.BibTeX: @article{9819786, title={Comparison between moexipril and atenolol in obese postmenopausal women with hypertension.}, author={Stimpel M and Koch B and Weber MA}, journal={Maturitas}, volume={30}, number={1}, pages={69-77}}
